) “Proof” is the establishment by evidence of a requisite degree of belief con- cerning a fact in the mind of the trier of fact or the court. Proof is the sufficient reason for assenting to the truth of a proposition advanced. In its judicial sense, it is a term of wide import and encompasses everything that may be adduced at a trial, within the legal rules, for the purpose of conviction in the mind of judge or jury. (

) “Evidence” is a much narrower term. It includes only such proof as is sible at trial by the act of the parties or through such concrete facts as witnesses, records, or other documents. Proof is the end result or effect of evidence, while evidence is the medium or means by which a fact is proved disproved. (

) These accounting adjustments are made by adding or deducting the or decrease in receivables and payables.
